title: Using the babytime R package
text: example generating weekly plan one parent : similar plan can set parent: Based timings, package going calculate days baby nursery due parents work. assumes parents aren’t work leave baby nursery. Run : spit lot tables. Look help page babytime see tables . ’re summarised two plots. First, plot weekly earnings:  Second, plot hours per week spent baby:
code: parent1_wp <- work_plan("2018-08-25",   # Baby's due date     on_leave(26),                         # 6 months on leave     working(26, "Mon-Fri 09:00-17:00"),   # 6 months working full time     working(104, "Mon-Thu 09:00-17:00")   # 6 months working mon-thu ) #> Warning: `data_frame()` was deprecated in tibble 1.1.0. #> Please use `tibble()` instead. parent1_wp #> # A tibble: 1,092 × 4 #>     week section section_week at_work                                          #>    <int>   <int>        <dbl> <Interval>                                       #>  1     1       1            1 2018-08-20 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-20 09:00:00 UTC #>  2     1       1            1 2018-08-21 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-21 09:00:00 UTC #>  3     1       1            1 2018-08-22 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-22 09:00:00 UTC #>  4     1       1            1 2018-08-23 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-23 09:00:00 UTC #>  5     1       1            1 2018-08-24 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-24 09:00:00 UTC #>  6     1       1            1 2018-08-25 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-25 09:00:00 UTC #>  7     1       1            1 2018-08-26 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-26 09:00:00 UTC #>  8     2       1            2 2018-08-27 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-27 09:00:00 UTC #>  9     2       1            2 2018-08-28 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-28 09:00:00 UTC #> 10     2       1            2 2018-08-29 09:00:00 UTC--2018-08-29 09:00:00 UTC #> # … with 1,082 more rows parent2_wp <- work_plan("2018-08-25",   # Baby's due date     working(26, "Mon-Fri 09:00-17:00"),   # 6 months working full time     on_leave(26),                         # 6 months on leave     working(104, "Mon-Thu 09:00-17:00")   # 6 months working tue-fri ) out <- babytime(parent1_wp = parent1_wp,          parent2_wp = parent2_wp,          baby_waking_time = "07:00",          baby_sleeping_time = "19:00",          parental_leave_option = 1,          statutory_weekly_pay = 156.66,          hourly_nursery_rate = 8.75,          parent1_annual_salary = 35000,          parent2_annual_salary = 32000,          annual_salary_increment = 0.02 ) out$earnings_plot out$babytime_plot sessionInfo() #> R version 4.2.1 Patched (2022-09-06 r82817) #> Platform: title: Authors and Citation
text: Hemani G, Walker J (2022). babytime: Shared parental leave calculator. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {babytime: Shared parental leave calculator},   author = {Gibran Hemani and Josephine Walker},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Shared parental leave calculator
text: babytime R package attempts map financial position different shared parental leave plans working nursery schedules occur shared parental leave, financial implications much time parent spending baby. assumes parents work University Bristol implements shared parental leave policy specified . ’s much rough implementation extensively tested. See vignette info use .

what: Calculating time and money based on parental leave and nursery — babytime
title: Calculating time and money based on parental leave and nursery — babytime
text: Calculating time money based parental leave nursery

title: Calculating time and money based on parental leave and nursery — babytime
code: babytime(   parent1_wp,   parent2_wp,   baby_waking_time,   baby_sleeping_time,   parental_leave_option,   statutory_weekly_pay = 156.66,   hourly_nursery_rate,   parent1_annual_salary,   parent2_annual_salary,   annual_salary_increment = 0.02 )

title: Calculating time and money based on parental leave and nursery — babytime
text: parent1_wp Work plan parent 1, output work_plan parent2_wp Work plan parent 2, output work_plan baby_waking_time Expected time baby wakes morning e.g. "07:00" baby_sleeping_time Expected time baby sleeps night e.g. "19:00" parental_leave_option Choose option 1 2 per http://www.bristol.ac.uk/hr/policies/shared-parental-leave.html statutory_weekly_pay Expected weekly pay (April 2022 156.66) hourly_nursery_rate Hourly nursery cost parent1_annual_salary Gross salary parent 1 day 1 parent2_annual_salary Gross salary parent 2 day 1 annual_salary_increment Expected annual increment, default=0.02

title: Calculating time and money based on parental leave and nursery — babytime
text: List results parent1_wp = Parent 1 working times parent2_wp = Parent 2 working times baby_schedule = Baby's schedule overlapping_times = Overlapping times parents baby parent1_salary = Parent 1 salary time parent2_salary = Parent 2 salary time statutory_parental_pay = Statutory parental pay time salary_loss = Salary reductions due leave nursery_cost = Nursery costs weekly_monies = Summary weekly incomes outgoings babytime = Summary time spent baby earnings_plot = Plot weekly net earnings babytime_plot = Plot weekly baby time

title: Generate working schedule table — work_plan
text: start_date First date table e.g. expected baby's due date ... list working leave periods. e.g. on_leave(26) signifies 26 weeks leave, working(104, "Mon-Thu 09:00-17:00") signifies 104 weeks working Monday Thursday 9-5.
